Method.Doc: returns the list of all columns of a given table

Body.Sql: SELECT c.ordinal_position as 'id', c.column_name as 'name', c.column_default as 'default', IF(c.is_nullable = 'NO', 'true', 'false') as 'required', CASE c.data_type WHEN 'varchar' then 'Text' WHEN 'text' then 'Text' WHEN 'longtext' then 'Text' WHEN 'mediumtext' then 'Text' WHEN 'int' then 'Int' WHEN 'bigint' then 'Int' WHEN 'tinyint' then 'Int' END as 'type', c.data_type as 'type_o', IF(c.character_maximum_length IS NULL, c.numeric_precision, c.character_maximum_length) as length, c.column_key as 'key', # k.referenced_table_name as 'datasource', # k.referenced_column_name as 'bindid', NULL as datasource, NULL as bindid, c.extra FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS c LEFT JOIN information_schema.KEY_COLUMN_USAGE k ON (c.column_name = k.column_name AND c.table_name = k.table_name AND k.constraint_schema = c.table_schema) WHERE c.table_name = '{param->entity}' AND c.table_schema = '{param->schema}'
